servers.description: Mana Pool Production API (uses live data)

info.title: Mana Pool Public API
info.description: This API provides integration endpoints allowing users to manage accounts, connect services, handle inventory, and process orders within the Mana Pool platform. To use this API, you must have a Mana Pool account and generate an API access token. To generate an access token, visit your integration settings in the Mana Pool dashboard. API Integration Settings Warning: The v1 API is still in active development and is subject to change without notice.

200.description: 200 OK - Returns an array of order reports with remediations

put.description: Register Order Created Webhook Warning: registering a new webhook for a topic will overwrite any existing webhook for that topic.

post.description:
Webhook requests use HMAC-based signatures so you can verify that ManaPool generated them.

Headers sent with every request:
- X-ManaPool-Event: order_created
- X-ManaPool-Timestamp: Unix timestamp (seconds) used when creating the signature
- X-ManaPool-Signature: comma-delimited key/value pairs (currently "t" and "v1") where
  v1 is the hex-encoded HMAC SHA-256 digest of "v1:${timestamp}:${rawBody}" computed with
  the webhook's secret

Verification steps:
1. Read the timestamp from the header and reject requests that are too old for your needs.
2. Re-create the signing payload string using the exact raw request body bytes.
3. Compute the HMAC SHA-256 digest with your stored webhook secret and compare it to the
   v1 value in the signature header (use a constant-time comparison if possible).

parameters.name: X-ManaPool-Timestamp
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) used when computing the signature

schema.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) used when computing the signature

parameters.name: X-ManaPool-Signature
parameters.description: Comma-delimited signature header (e.g. `t=<timestamp>,v1=<hmac>`). See operation description for verification details.

schema.description: Comma-delimited signature header (e.g. `t=<timestamp>,v1=<hmac>`). See operation description for verification details.

200.description: Expected server response if the webhook is accepted

secret.description:
Shared secret used to verify webhook signatures (see callback description for details).
The secret is only returned at creation time; if it is lost you must reregister the webhook.

Shared secret used to verify webhook signatures (see callback description for details).
The secret is only returned at creation time; if it is lost you must reregister the webhook.
